title: Easy One-Pot Miso Soup Recipe
full_text:
Easy One-Pot Miso Soup Recipe

4
to 6 servings

(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1 1/2
quarts
water
1/2

kombu
(approximate 4- by 6-inch piece, see notes)
1/2
ounce
grated
bonito flakes
(about 3 cups, see notes)
6
tablespoons
white or red
miso paste
, or a mix
8

firm
silken tofu

fresh

4

scallions

Directions
Combine water, kombu, and bonito flakes in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to a bare simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, let cool for 5 minutes, then strain through a fine-mesh strainer. Discard solids.
Return broth to a medium saucepan and set over low heat to keep warm, but not boiling. Place a fine-mesh strainer in broth and add miso paste to the strainer. Use the back of a spoon to press paste through strainer into broth. Discard any large grains that don't pass through.
Add tofu, wakame, mushrooms, and cockles (if using), and allow to cook without boiling until ingredients are warm and wakame has rehydrated, about 5 minutes. Garnish with scallions (if using) and serve immediately.
Special Equipment
Fine-mesh strainer
, large and medium saucepans
Notes
Kombu and katsuobushi can be found in any Japanese market or in the international section of most well-stocked supermarkets. For best results, use real kombu and katsuobushi. Alternatively, you can use powdered dashi mix. Follow instructions on the package.
